awd_titl_txt: Antarctic Neutral Thermospheric and Mesospheric Dynamics    and Thermodynamics
awd_abstract_narration: This project will continue the operation of the Fabry-Perot                     interferometer that was installed at South Pole Station in early                1989.  The instrument measures the temperature of the atmosphere                and the winds in the mesosphere and lower thermosphere (MALT)                   region of the upper atmosphere.  The instrument will be operated                in conjunction with the existing collection of aeronomy instruments             at South Pole, as well as with the coherent scatter radar at Halley             Bay Station which is jointly funded by NSF and the British                      Antarctic Survey (BAS).  Together they will give a more complete                picture of high altitude atmospheric dynamics at high latitude, and             provide important information for the verification and subsequent               modification of the thermospheric global circulation model that has             been developed at the National Center for Atmospheric Research.                 This project is an important component of the Coupling, Energetic               and Dynamics through Atmospheric Regions (CEDAR) initiative.                                                                                                    This project is jointly funded by the Division of Polar Programs'               Polar Aeronomy and Astrophysics and the Division of Atmospheric                 Sciences' Aeronomy programs.
